title: Toddler's 'reckless' ride on Auckland motorway
text:
Toddler's 'reckless' ride on Auckland motorway Last updated 17:41, February 1 2017 1 News Now 
Bronson Makiri posted the video on Facebook with the sarcastic commentary: "That's some awesome parenting". 
A toddler has been spotted standing up, unrestrained, in a convertible car travelling down an Auckland motorway. 
The two-year-old was standing in the back seat of the moving vehicle while it travelled through Spaghetti Junction on Tuesday. 
The incident was captured on video by a stunned motorist, who could be heard shouting at the mother to restrain her child. TVNZ 
A video of the the unrestrained child emerged on Facebook. 
Police were alerted to the incident by a concerned member of the public and said they had since spoken to the driver of the car, the child's mother and grandmother about the importance of child restraints.
